intro: Geniostoma gracile, commonly known as the slender geniostoma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, with a distinctive central disc. Geniostoma gracile is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in warm, humid climates.
